steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2njtk","text":"Prepare consecutive FFPE tissue sections series on PEN slides and SuperFrost Plus slides according to the experiment design.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gedd","text":"Ideally, cut all slides from the same FFPE block in one sitting (no extra trimming in between). Sections should be  thick on PEN slides for LCM, and   thick on SuperFrost Plus slides for other staining purposes. Make sure tissues are attached to the membrane area of PEN slides. {"blocks":[{"key":"7qgnq","text":"For the reference slides and annotation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ae58","text":"Pick SuperFrost Plus slides adjacent to PEN slides as references. It can be stained with desired methods, e.g., H\u0026E, AB-PAS, fluorescence, etc. This protocol continues with H\u0026E staining as an example.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Stain the slides with the desired methods. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d84j2","text":"Scan the whole reference slide to generate a digital image of the full tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eslu","text":"Annotate histological regions of interest(ROIs) on the digital images. The step is essential since the ROIs may not be recognizable on LCM due to compromised resolution and dried tissue section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e20mo","text":"It is not recommended to stain PEN slides until the annotation is completed since step 4 to step 15.10 should be finished within one month to guarantee the sample quality.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq5e8","text":"Make sure all the apparatus and reagents are clean and freshly prepared to avoid contamination. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7esa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmnor","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6njsq","text":"Leave the slides dry in the fume hood overnight. Keep slides as clean as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":95,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7riof","text":"!! This step can be prolonged for 2-3 min if the liquid is not flowing through, but be careful not to leave SDB-RPS disks dry for too long.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7hh8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"750","duration":480,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16kmn","text":"Carefully disassemble the racks and take out PCR tubes from the collection plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61h0g","text":"Vacuum-dry completely at  .  It takes approximately 1 hour. If necessary, prolong the drying time until all samples are completely dried. A thin layer of white powder should be visible inside the PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"949lg","text":"Close the PCR tubes with caps and seal the closed PCR tubes with parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DFF9A9425E2A11EFB6440A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"45","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cah83","text":"Now the samples are ready for final preparation for mass spectrometry measurement according to experimental and instrumental setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l38d","text":"Peptides can be stored at   until reconstitution for mass spectrometry measurement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"51cct","text":"The StageTips can be kept at   until the mass spectrometry measurement result is received.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D0F1E16B5E2A11EFB6440A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D0F1E1EB5E2A11EFB6440A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}
